headline: After near fight at debate, Gibbons and Mandel face each other at GOP breakfast
author: Scott Wartman
sentences: SHARONVILLE, Ohio – Hours after an ugly confrontation on a debate stage in the Columbus area, Ohio Republican Senate candidates Mike Gibbons and Josh Mandel went to breakfast together on Saturday.

'Embarrassing for the whole party'
The confrontation between Gibbons and Mandel doesn't reflect well on the Republican Party, Vance told The Enquirer on Saturday.
Instead, the five Republican GOP Senate candidates quietly dined on pancakes with hundreds of Republicans in a suburban Cincinnati hotel conference room.
Mandel stood by his actions in an interview with The Enquirer after the breakfast, which was hosted by the Northeast Hamilton County Republican Club.
Both sets of Senate candidates are scheduled to debate on March 28 at Central State University in events sponsored by the Ohio Debate Commission.
The belly-bumping confrontation between Gibbons and Mandel on the debate stage the night before had become the talk of political social media.
Former Ohio Republican Party Chair Jane Timken, also running in the Senate primary, echoed Vance's verdict, calling the event "embarrassing."

The Democratic candidates will debate from 11:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. and the Republicans from 7 p.m. to 8:30 p.m.

What happened Friday night
The anger boiled over Friday night on a debate stage in Gahanna, a Columbus suburb.
Video footage showed Mandel standing up and approaching Gibbons while Gibbons was addressing the audience.
